Science Leadership Academy is an inquiry-driven, project-based environment where all learning is focused around our core values of inquiry, research, collaboration, presentation and reflection. At SLA, we believe in the ethic of care, meaning that we believe we teach students before we teach subjects.

school_name: South Bronx Community Charter High School
school_district: South Bronx Community Charter High School
school_description: At its core, SBC is a deeply embedded source of support, growth, and opportunity for our young people and families in the South Bronx. Our commitment to competency-based education, culturally responsive practices, integrated social and emotional learning, and human-centered design has guided our development since our founding in 2016. Our competency based approach has proven successful in building the critical thinking, problem-solving and writing skills that we know are necessary for post-secondary success. Our integrated practices around social and emotional learning are enabled by an innovative staffing model which has provided personalized learning support for students, more favorable staff:student ratios, intensive advising, and more.

Our learning environment is learner-focused. We focus on the education of the whole child. Academics, social emotional learning, and 21st Century skills, and  are blended to meet the learners needs. We personalize student learning with a variety of voice and choice through standards based learning.  We want our learners to graduate TIGER Ready for postsecondary success.

We believe in the infinite power of young people. So we created educational programs to harness that power, right here and right now. In 2011 we designed a new educational approach that combines classical content and skills with real-world problem-solving. Tahoe Expedition Academy includes a fully accredited K-12th-Grade school, robust summer programs, and engaging after-school clubs that educate hundreds more young people each year. Our graduates are enrolled in some of the nations best colleges and universities and, perhaps more importantly, our current students are having a positive impact on the world around them, right here and right now.

school_name: The Center For Advanced Research And Technology (Cart)
school_description:
The Center for Advanced Research and Technology (CART) High School is one of the most comprehensive, state-of-the-art education reform effort at the secondary level to date. CART combines rigorous academics with technical, design, process, entrepreneurial, and critical thinking skills.  The learning model is delivered through a hands-on, project-based approach and is applicable to the real-world.
Eleventh and twelfth grade students from the Clovis and Fresno Unified School Districts are bused to CART where they attend half-day classes in one of the 13 Career and Tech Education laboratories taught by teams of instructors from both education and business.
suggested_tags: Project-based, Hands-on, Applicable real world learning, unique student and adult culture, unique student population.

school_description: The Upper School emphasizes low teacher: student ratio and operates using Mastery Teaching and Learning protocol. Teacher summarize taught content quarterly. Each quarter--across all subjects--students must pass these tests to 80% in order to master.  A core tenet of the Mastery Teaching and Learning protocol is that every student gets up to three tries on three versions of these Mastery Tests.
suggested_tags: Mastery Teaching and Learning Protocol, College preparatory, Real World Learning, Dual-credit opportunities, and cross-cultural collaborations.

school_description: Place and project based urban farm school, driven by students, facilitated by adults.

WAVE is a teacher-powered high school program for students in Washtenaw County school districts. We offer a flexible, personalized, student-centered, and project-based approach to learning for students who need an alternative to the traditional high school model. Support is provided through an advisory teacher and online content support teachers. Staff work together to design and administer academic programming that meets the state standards and prepares each student for further education and career skills. We value fostering a sense of curiosity about the world to become lifelong learners. We value a community where staff vision and student voices build the program.
focus_other_text: Students from other marginalized social identities (gender, socioeconomic status, etc)

school_description: SEA-Tech seeks to attract students who are first generation college-going, at-risk of dropping out due to a lack of apparent relevance and alignment to interests, or in need of accelerated academic instruction. Through SEA-Tech, students have access to a unique high school experience. In essence, we are exactly like nothing else. The school mission, emphasizing Exploration, Empowerment, and Contribution, ensures that students graduate empowered with the knowledge and skills needed for effective participation in a global economy as world-class workers, productive citizens, and contributors to society.

school_desc_other_text: Collaboration between local nonprofit and the local public school system
school_description: Students and staff at Next STEP operate in a dynamic learning environment, in which co-creation drives everything (curriculum, programming, and space). Our culture is dedicated to building community across lines of difference. It is also a model to be observed, learned from, and connected with as we seek to bring positive change across our district. Next STEP is designed for the most vulnerable populations (i.e. those with the most number of barriers to learning) but it does not exclusively serve those populations. Students opt-in to the community because they truly want to do our kind of community-driven and design-focused work.

Our school provides multiple pathways to graduation using a personalized approach. Our goal is to implement a student-centered approach to education, meeting our students where they are. Virtual learning is a tool that allows us versatility. The key ingredients are our teachers and mentors who design a personalized learning experience and provide instructional support in a primarily asynchronous environment.

Gull Lake Virtual Partnership is first a virtual school, offering a robust selection of core and elective courses to students in grades K-12. While we have more than 1,100 full and part-time students, virtually no two student schedules are the same. We embrace an any time, any place, any pace learning model. Students are encouraged to follow their passions in choosing courses and projects in order to earn credit. Our school offers enriching learning opportunities in our school and community that allow students to apply the learning from their virtual courses. Our dedicated staff work to ensure the success of every student, as that student defines success.
Hazen Union School combines classroom and community-based learning.  Students can create flexible and accountable learning experiences that help them build relevance in their learning.

TLC is a model of full inclusion and diverse-by-design schooling in elementary education. Our curriculum is universally designed and arts-enriched, and our learning environment promotes respect and celebrates what makes each of us special and unique. Our diverse community includes: students with disabilities, low-income students, gifted students, English Learners, and students who bring a wealth varied cultures, experiences, beliefs, goals, and interests. Co-teaching structures, daily staff collaboration, and highly trained bilingual/bicultural paraprofessional staff distinguish TLC as a model demonstration and innovation site dedicated to continual improvement in the field.
suggested_tags:
* active learning strategies
* English Learner support: integrated and designated instruction
* positive behavior support and expectations

school_description: By intentionally partnering instructional time in the classroom with ongoing access to technology, students are provided with a personalized learning platform capable of meeting their individual academic needs. Additionally, our blended learning model affords learners the opportunity to take ownership of their experience by promoting both their voice and their choice. Student growth and achievement is measured frequently by our staff with research-based assessments, and students understand and intentionally track their individual performance.
suggested_tags: We provide our students enrichment opportunities during the school day by utilizing community providers that come in to share their passion.

school_description: By intentionally partnering instructional time in the classroom with ongoing access to technology, students are provided with a personalized learning platform capable of meeting their individual academic needs. Additionally, our blended learning model affords learners the opportunity to take ownership of their experience by promoting both their voice and their choice. Student growth and achievement is measured frequently by our staff with research-based assessments, and students understand and intentionally track their individual performance.
suggested_tags:
ENRICHMENT OPPORTUNITIES
Increasing students exposure to learning opportunities beyond the traditional academic setting, BNS provides all learners with high quality, comprehensive experiences as part of the weekly academic schedule. These offerings include classes in five unique categories: S.T.E.M, Health & Athletics, Arts & Culture, Leadership, and Academics. This invaluable time allows our students to learn from and work with high quality instructors through formal community partnerships.

school_description: Great Oaks Charter provides students with a small group learning environment through the incorporation of AmeriCorps Fellows into core classes. AmeriCorps Fellows deliver targeted intervention in small groups under the direction of a certified classroom teacher.
suggested_tags: Tutoring, Mentoring, Blended Environment, Extended Opportunities, Social Justice, Social Activism, Student Voice, Small Groups

school_description: The Workshop School is a project-based, public high school in West Philadelphia. Our model is based on creating a child-centered community that supports authentic learning. Academic learning and skill-building at the Workshop School revolve around authentic, real-world work. This helps  students see the relevance and meaning in what they are learning, which boosts engagement. It also demands, and  builds, the type of holistic skill set that is generally not a focus in high schools but is absolutely critical to  postsecondary success. Authentic learning takes different forms, including interdisciplinary projects, school-based  businesses, internships, consultancies (projects with external partners or clients), and dual enrollment programs.

school_name: The Museum School of Avondale Estates
school_description:
The interactive nature of The Museum School's education model is its most dynamic feature. Based on data showing children learn best through personal discovery and hands-on experience, the museum concept is a proven school model of project-based learning and real-world
exploration. Partnerships with history centers, science museums and other learning institutions bring tangibility to classroom lessons.
Frequent learning expeditions give children a chance to ask questions, make observations, reflect on experiences and draw conclusions. Intensive curriculum development ensures that classroom discussions are reinforced and enhanced through interactive personal experience.

Lewisburg school is dedicated to providing a learning experience that is grounded in the belief that students should be given an opportunity to reach proficiency in critical work skills. This means students should have an opportunity each day to be creative, communicate effectively, and lead.
nominator: Kentucky Department of Education: Office of Continuous Improvement and Support

school_description: Nokomis Regional High is a four-year high school located in Newport, Maine, serving the eight surrounding rural towns of RSU 19. As a school community, we want every Warrior to have an amazing journey through high school that leads to a solid after high school plan  We recognize that there are many pathways a student may choose and we want to provide a wide range of traditional and innovative learning opportunities for ALL students. We want all Warriors to not only have a meaningful experience while in high school but also use this time to imagine and investigate the possibilities for their future so they are ready for the next phase of their life. We are a close-knit community and truly care for one another.  We're Warriors here!

An innovative, student-centered environment, Uxbridge High School prides itself on authentic learning and connecting curricular outcomes with industry partners. The school's professional learning culture focuses on the process of learning and balancing skills with content, using core values of collaboration, independence, and personal responsibility to drive learning outcomes.

The Albuquerque Sign Language Academy is a state certified dual language school that serves deaf/hard of hearing, hearing and special needs students by leveraging American Sign Language to unite the deaf, hearing, and disability communities through an inclusive learning environment.  Strong language development skills programming coupled with tenets of project based learning and peer assisted learning  create a engaging learning environment where all students feel challenged and valued.

Spring Grove Schools is a human-centered system where student, staff, and parents work together to create a learning atmosphere that supports the whole child as they take ownership of their learning and future.
suggested_tags: human-centered design, student-centered network, place-based, community based

school_name: Paladin Career And Technical High School
school_district: Paladin Career and Technical High School
school_description:
Paladin Career & Technical High School is a public charter school that utilizes a holistic approach to to meet the needs of each student. We focus on building relationships first. Here, students and teachers voices have power, and school leadership takes all perspectives and needs into account when planning for the future. Our school community recognizes  that food, shelter, clothing, access to healthcare, safety, respect,
and a sense of belonging are prerequisites to social, emotional, and academic growth.Through our trauma-responsive, social emotional learning, and restorative practice approach, Paladin students learn personal responsibility, self-confidence, and the importance of being engaged in community.
focus_other_text: Students who have experienced educational trauma.
contact_role: Student Success Coordinator, Social Studies Educator, SBG Cohort Lead
respondent_role: Academic & Instruction Coordinator, Success Coordinator, Language Arts Teacher

school_desc_other_text: We also have the Institute for Self Directed Learning www.selfdirect.school
school_description: The Forest School and The Forest School Online serve grades PreK4 through 12 and offer learner-driven technology, Socratic discussions, hands-on projects, and real-world apprenticeships in an intentionally diverse, self-directed, and character-forging community. Our mission is that every person who enters our doors will find a calling that will change the world. Through research, consulting, and curriculum development, our school's Institute for Self Directed Learning partners with public school districts, charter networks, independent schools, and universities to equip educators and school leaders to design and lead schools and classrooms that move students from being dependent learners to becoming self-directed, independent learners.
suggested_tags: Self-directed, intentionally diverse, character forging, and purpose driven
contact_role: Executive Assistant to the Head of School

school_desc_other_text: Blended approach with drop in center support
school_description: We are a virtual alternative education high school with drop in center support.  They do not have to come into the center unless they wish to or if they need additional support that can be given by center staff.
focus_other_text: We serve students that are not being served or underserved due to the at-risk nature of our students.

school_description: Paramount Brookside is a high performing and supportive academic environment with built-in systems for social and emotional learning. We are founded on the strong belief that all students have the ability to thrive academically.
suggested_tags: The overall of success of the school speaks to the quality of teachers that have been hired to support our students.

school_description: Manara Leadership Academy provides students with a creative, adaptive and ethical learning environment, to prepare students to become future leaders of the society. We provide high academic achievement and a firm command of a foreign language. At Manara Leadership Academy, we address the individual needs of students, their families and their communities by building on the strengths of students' cultural heritage and life experiences to enable and support them to become successful. We believe in innovation, hands-on experience, and life-long learning for all students.
suggested_tags: Accelerated and aligned with the TEKS.

school_description: Detroit Preps work focuses on holistically educating each student. Our work is active, hands on, inclusive, equitable, and excellent. We believe kids learn best when there's a strong sense of belonging, character development, and high quality work that makes an impact beyond the classroom.

Exploration High School is a public school for public good. We are led by students, powered by teachers, and rooted in our community. With the Twin Cities as our extended classroom, Explorers master relevant, 21st century skills by executing Community Asset Projects (CAPs) which ignite their passions and improve our world. Explorers are supported by a team of advisors dedicated to student empowerment, personalized learning, and innovation. We believe every young person deserves an education that embraces their vision and identity and challenges them to achieve their potential.
suggested_tags: design thinking, co-creative process with students, relationship-based, interdisciplinary, hands-on learning

school_description: We are a blended program that combines competency based online core classes with direct teacher support and engaging in-person collaborative elective experiences to maximize the best of both environments.
suggested_tags: We seek to operate like an adult workplace putting students in a college or adult workplace type setting where they experience the freedoms and responsibilities at this level.
nominator: Clayton Christensen Institute and The Learning Accelerator

school_description: Personalized competency-based learning at this district magnet Launch High School. The school focuses on design thinking and projects in partnership with local community businesses and organizations.

At Liberty Academy, our programming is designed for interest based exploration, collaborative menu design, real world off-campus engagement, and long term personal growth.   Our daily environment is communal with a strong focus on human agency, mentor based relationships, and personalized pathway design in a competency based academic setting.  Our students don't have classrooms, our teachers don't have desks, and our schedule is subject free and flexible to the hour.  Our school isn't designed to help students prepare for specific careers, it's designed to help students figure out what comes next as a result of the things they're learning about themselves.
suggested_tags: We're designed for where society and school is headed rather than where it is now.

school_description: Brooklyn Free School is a social justice based school. It is a school that supports student voice and choice. We talk about the worked in real yet age appropriate terms. At the same time, the social emotional growth of the students are vital. We have all school democratic meetings, mediations, advisory meetings and ultimately students can call meetings at any time. Students choose their classes and decide their own schedule. Younger students spend much of their day on play indoors with lot's of time in the part. BFS is a community. It is an opportunity for students to be themselves and know themselves. They also learn to build community and they learn to gain the tools to change the world.

Red Bridge is a school that teaches students to set goals, reflect, collaborate and own their learning. The Red Bridge vision is for all students to develop a sense of agency over their learning and lives, so that no matter what the future looks like they have the capacity to adapt and flourish. We define agency as having the ability to set meaningful goals and the will and skill to achieve them.

Long-View Learning runs a micro school and also runs practice-based teacher institutes. The two work in tandem to support innovation in K-12 education. Our micro school is inspiring in its challenge of the status quo. More than a school, it is conceived of as a learning environment for children and adults, as we know learning is so much larger of a human activity than just schooling. The children are grouped in bands that operate as learning communities, the content is challenging and ideas-focused, and the pedagogy has a strong research base. Our school runs with a distributed leadership model. Lastly, our teacher institutes support educators working to make structural, cultural, and pedagogical changes that support deeper learning.
suggested_tags:
intellectually rigorous
higher-order skills/4 C's
deep conceptual learning
focus on self-regulation
development of metacognitive skills
no homework
distributed leadership
coherence of pedagogy across school
high levels of teacher collaboration

school_name: St. Paul School Of Northern Lights
school_district: St. Paul School Of Northern Lights
school_description: Share the joy of an intellectually rigorous learning community by discovering Northern Lights, a free, K-8 public charter school. We are reimagining education through responsive inquiry in thought-provoking indoor and outdoor environments.

Students identify and pursue personal passions within the classes led by teachers who, in turn, encourage and work alongside students to develop their skills so that they can effectively collaborate on dynamic projects.  

Students AND teachers are encouraged to try new things without fear of failure.  Creativity is nurtured, collaboration is encouraged, and leaders take shape with an entrepreneurial spirit and an eye on making the world a better place.
Moving students to be Self-Aware, Globally Connected, and a Learner for Life!

At Middle Park High School we take great pride in our academic programs; our local community; and the achievements of our staff, students, and graduates. Through our Homegrown Talent Initiative, we provide opportunities for students to gain exposure to career pathways utilizing job shadows, internships and work based learning opportunities.  These experiences help to broaden skills and competencies, providing career-connected learning experiences that align with the needs and aspirations of our local economy, while at the same time leaving students better prepared for life after high school. MPHS Graduates are; critical thinkers, creative innovators, responsible collaborators, global citizens, lifelong learners, and effective communicators.

school_district: Steamboat Springs School District NO. Re 2
school_description: Yampa Valley High School serves students who benefit from a smaller and more personalized learning environment. We emphasize building a healthy school community, inquiry based learning, and career connectedness.  Students' learning path can include in-person, blended, and online learning along with concurrent enrollment and work based courses.

Elevate Academy is a 6-12 grade Career Technical Education school that serves disenfranchised students.  All teaching and learning at Elevate is purpose driven, and centered around the student.  We intentionally work to expose and develop a students talents so they are able to own their educational journey.  We believe Elevate provides education that is for and with the student not being done to the student.  Our unique mastery approach aligns core content with the career technical education courses so that students are learning information in a relevant meaningful way.  Nothing is taught in a silo, and students can see and articulate the why behind everything they are learning.
focus_other_text: We are a school that serves all at-risk youth.

school_description:
Crossroads FLEX is a digital, blended learning school. Crossroads FLEX serves students whose outside interests and activities require considerable amounts of time during regular school hours known as pursuits. Pursuits can include highly competitive and active students in the arts, sports, and entrepreneurship. Crossroads FLEX allows students to meet those obligations while meeting all requirements for high school graduation and college and career readiness.
A Crossroads FLEX student is responsible, self-motivated, engaged, and exhibits the highest degree of integrity. Crossroads FLEXs vision is to guide and graduate students whose individual pursuits empower them to emblazon change upon the world.

school_district: El Paso County Colorado School District 49
school_description: SSAE is based on the concept that parents, students, and faculty must partner to fully maximize the potential of all students and ensure a successful academic journey. As a foundational core value, we believe that building relational capacity with students and parents is a top priority because students and families must believe that SSAE is a safe and healthy place to send their students to every day.  Through flexible learning models, high levels of support, balanced on campus and virtual work, within a rigorous curriculum all students can be prepared for whatever path they choose after high school.

Learning Model: Strategies to Support and Retain BIPOC Educators by Emphasizing Instructional Expertise
Description: Strategies used at a high performing school to recruit and retain BIPOC educators. We start with the fundamental belief that our educators - and particularly our BIPOC educators - want to be true experts in their craft in order to provide the very best to their students. We also believe - as a leadership team - that our teachers are the hardest working people in the building, and we commit to ensuring that every minute they spend with us will grow their expertise.  We set a standard for professional growth in the building.

The Helen S Dunn School is a PreK through Grade 8 school that focuses on creating a learning environment that values students' happiness, their interests, and individual strengths. While we still teach all core subjects, we also include teaching and learning opportunities outside of the classroom and off-campus. During COVID 19, when other field trip opportunities closed, we began an Outdoor Adventure Classroom at a nearby camp so students could be outside and learn first-hand about the Maine woods and waterways, the environment, how to cook for themselves, trail maintenance, forestry, survival skills, building projects, and forging friendships. This year, we expanded the program to include a paddling program for Grades 5-8.
focus_other_text: We don't currently have any students who are bilingual, newcomers, or in the juvenile justice system
contact_role: Superintendent, Principal, and Outdoor Adventure Classroom Teacher
respondent_role: Superintendent, Principal, and Outdoor Adventure Classroom Teacher

school_description:
We are a small pre-k to 12 school located in a rural community. We aspire to design and implement high quality projects that are relevant to students lives and encourage them to take an active role in guiding their education. We live our values of  respect, responsibility, kindness, and engagement through a project-based approach to learning that places strong emphasis on authenticity, culture & relationships, and curiosity, creativity, & design.

We strive to ensure all students are engaged and active learners within a culture of inclusion that values all students as contributing members of our school community. We approach students through a lens of inquiry, honoring their voices, their questions, their curiosity, and their creativity.
nominator: Vermont Agency of Education and Mastery Transcript Consortium

school_name: CLK Engage At CLK Elementary School
school_district: Public Schools Of Calumet Laurium Keweenaw
school_description: CLK Engage is a student-centered multi-age program currently for students in grades 1-3.  Although the program includes multi-age students, the three teachers and students are one community to create a positive learning environment based on the Capturing Kids Hearts model.  Students are grouped together based on assessments and progress demonstrated throughout the school year in language arts and math.  The multi-age classroom structure focuses on personalized learning to meet students where they are in their learning progression.
nominator: Horizons Alternative Education School and MiCoOp

school_description: We have implemented a personalized competency-based learning system which values the individual gifts every learner brings to our learning environment.  We recognize all learners are different and our system meets learners where they are at in their learning.  Through a purposeful approach in designing relevant and authentic learning experiences, we are creating choice ready learners who will change the world.
suggested_tags: It is a system which values accountability, adaptability, communication, leadership, and a learner's mindset.

school_description: Flexible Pathways Academy is a flexible model of school that supports and encourages students to design their own learning pathways.

Rooted in principles of design thinking, our student-centered approach to schooling is grounded in empathy addressing both shared and personal challenges at every age level. Students are constantly reimagining the curriculum by exploring authentic problems relevant to their peers and the broader community. The design thinking mind-shift allows students and educational designers to continuously reimagine the entry point to learning at The Delta School. In partnership with classroom educators, professional experts, and a community engaged in tackling real-world challenges, students explore relevant content while cultivating modern day competencies resulting in meaningful and purposeful outcomes. This is learning reimagined.
suggested_tags: Studio mentality/approach to learning. Teachers as educational designers, not deliverers or instructors of content. Students as partners in educational design. Students are being endorsed for life, not graduating from school.

school_description: Clark Street Community School is a learner centered environment which cultivates engagement by fostering connections with each other, with our community, and with relevant learning experiences.  Our instructional model is personalized, inclusive, interdisciplinary, place-based and competency based and designed to ensure every learner develops a deep sense of their own brilliance within a community of learners.

Career Path High is a blended model maximizing technology to provide a personalized competency based learning opportunity.  CPH is located on the campus of Davis Technical College and provides the opportunity for all students to earn a high school diploma and career certification.

We are a proficiency based learning organization committed to equity and focused on student learning and growth in the areas of academic success, social / emotional health and well being and student voice and engagement using inclusive practices that are universally designed, culturally and linguistically responsive.
suggested_tags: We are in the process of shifting to a new innovation model beginning with the 2022-23 school year, in which 9th graders will rotate through a series of design thinking courses that include the content areas of art, music, science and engineering while upper level students will have the opportunity for a flexible pathway that allows for self-directed learning in the innovative center supported by both teachers and community mentors and business partners.

school_description: Acton Academy Venice Beach is a learner-driven, micro school that integrates personalized learning, Socratic discussions, hands on projects, and real-world apprenticeships in a community built on character and critical thinking.  Rigorous academics are combined with real world problem solving in an environment where students interests, passions, and talents drive the learning.

Phoenix Modern is a K-8 non-traditional charter school for an intentionally diverse population in the heart of midtown Phoenix. Our team set forth on a mission to reimagine learning so that children could grow and flourish in our modern world. We rejected an outdated industrial era model of single age classrooms, standardized curriculum, and fixed grading. Instead, our program design and culture was informed by a mix of research and child-centered practices found in many learning models, including Montessori and Reggio Emilia based programs, and enhanced with modern resources and contexts in a small, tight-knit community.
suggested_tags: Reggio-emilia, learner-driven, whole-child approach, socratic, small, tight-knit community

school_description: Students at Holladay and in the community receive wrap around reading support, from trained reading coaches, at school, home, and hubs in places of worship. Each student receives technology, rewards, and a small home library.

Rise Academy is an interest based high school where students are in charge of thier education. They develop a learning plan with Outcomes, Milestones, and steps to take that becomes the cornerstone of their learning. Some outcomes are based on what a student sees for themselves 10 to 20 years down the line, while other outcomes are survival based. We serve a population that include students of average means, students in poverty, and homeless students. The approach we are using is about relevance to each student. With this in mind, students learn what they need to know, when they need to know - Just in Time Learning. Academics is not the center of education in this model - the student is.
focus_other_text: This is an inclusive school that is designed to adapt to any student's particular situation.
suggested_tags:
We are Intentional
Stay Fluid
Build Relationships
Be Flexibile

school_description: Sequoyah is a project-based college preparatory program that values challenging, real-world experiences, within a culture that celebrates human dignity.
suggested_tags: Deeper learning, PBL, CBL, purpose-driven learning

school_description: Springhouse is a school for regenerative culture builders. We are committed to awakening vitality-centered education that responds to the world's emerging needs in service to the vision of life-giving culture. Unlike schools that teach siloed subjects and measure progress and learning by tests and grades, Springhouses educational approach is unique with relationships at the core of all that we do. Springhouse has created an educational design that fosters interconnection, diversity, collaboration, and emergence, and this design is now shared globally through the Sourced Design Network.
suggested_tags: regenerative; life-centered; vitality-centered; life-giving; emergent; relevant; intergenerational; learning through relationship; place-based; holistic; focuses on healthy human psycho-spiritual development; growing elders; educational design as cultural design; education as a way to pass down regenerative values, skills, and knowledge

school_description: The Sycamore School provides personalized, engaging and experiential learning, helping students make connections across content areas and to the real world.
suggested_tags:
Mastery or Competency-Based Learning 
We have three roots: 
1) Academic Skill Building
2) Social Emotional Development
3) Civic Engagement

school_district: Utah Schools for the Deaf and Blind
school_desc_other_text: Public School that serves deaf, blind, and deafblind students from 0 - 22
school_description:
USDB provides personalized services to deaf, hard of hearing, blind, visually impaired, and deafblind students. This occurs at our various campuses or classrooms within other school districts and individually with a singular student in a district throughout the state.  
Deaf and hard-of-hearing students receive support through language-embedded approaches.  Teachers incorporate personal technology and technologically advanced classrooms.  Direct instruction is provided to students in American Sign Language in our special schools.  For those students housed in district programs and needing ASL, interpreters are provided. 
Blind students receive individual support for orientation and mobility and extra curricular support.

We have purposed to create a safe, supportive, challenging and innovative environment for our K-8th grade students.  We have created the school to purpose pipeline which allows for each student to take ownership of their learning process and behavior management in a flexible and comfortable learning environment.
suggested_tags: Our learning environment is flexible and provides alternative seating arrangements that cater to that student's particular needs, i.e., sit on floor, on couch, in chair, etc.
nominator: Center on Reinventing Public Education and Transcend

school_description: Small classrooms combine best of in-person learning experience in small and whole groups informed by self-paced work on world-class personalized learning platforms.
suggested_tags: Individualized learning trajectories where parents are engaged in goal setting for their child.

school_description: Content rich, collaborative- Problem based, creative, community, charterer driven environment.  Dayspring established pathways where every learner can earn stackable industry certifications and College level credits while in K-12. The goal being learners earning their AA degree.

""The Servers Not the Served!"" This is the motto of our team: Chautauqua students, all of whom are ages 18-22 with an Individual Education Plan, the Chautauqua staff, and Bay High School mentors from the Advanced International Certificate of Education program of Cambridge University, Cambridge UK, learn by providing substantive needed service through a sophisticated service learning methodology. Projects locally and numerous projects on all seven continents address issues that have positive impacts for our natural allies: the poor, elderly, marginalized and those with disabilities. To facilitate full inclusion, no participants are allowed to fund their travel. Travel is learning and the cost is built into the flat organizational structure.
suggested_tags: Empowering. We also follow the intrinsic motivation model of 'I belong, I am needed. And. I have agency.'

school_description: Vimenti is a two generation approach model that empowers the whole family to achieve economic and social mobility. The Vimenti School at it's core offers a rigorous and differentiated dual language learning to allow students to thrive at their readiness level. Vimenti aims to empower students and families to embrace education as a lifelong skill.
suggested_tags:
One stop center of services for students and families.
Families and students needs focus.
Health and Wellness focused environment for all school community.

school_name: Foundation School Of Autism - San Antonio
school_description: Foundation School of Autism exists to provide an individualized, research based education to children with autism that focuses on the development of social, communication, and academic skills.

school_desc_other_text: We are both a school and service provider for schools in AZ and nationally/internationally
school_description: ASU Prep Digital is part of ASU Prep Academy, a network of K-12 college prep schools and programming, operating via a spectrum of instructional delivery models, including site-based schools with a blended learning approach, hybrid and micro school models, co-teaching models for both daily and supplemental instruction, and a fully virtual model.  We put into practice our belief that a single approach cannot meet the needs of every student, so our goal is to continually and imaginatively leverage human, curricular, and technological resources to address student and family needs.

TTu K-12 is a completely virtual, asynchronous academic program serving K-12 students in the US and internationally. Our rigorous curriculum meets all Texas state standards and is reading- and writing-intensive.  We were established by the Texas legislature in 1993 and have served almost 500,000 students since that time.  We serve full-time students in a tuition-free, tuition-paid, and international concurrent diploma program.  In addiiton to the 2500 full-time students served, we serve approximately 20,000 supplemental students each year who take just one or a few courses from us while remaining enrolled in their home schools.
suggested_tags: Self-paced; students can access learning platform 24/7; rigorous; reading- and writing-intensive; college and career preparatory; learning coach; open enrollment; asynchonous; Cognia accredited; award-winning; full-time and supplemental options.

school_description:
In 2018-2019, A. Vito Martinez Middle School (AVM) was awarded exemplary status by the Illinois State Board of Education. This status is awarded to the top ten percent of middle schools in the state for growth among all subgroup areas. This success is attributed to a student focused environment that sets high expectations and provides support to all learners. The school was primed to achieve the same status the following year, but was interrupted by the pandemic. 

Visible learning, culturally responsive teaching, and the importance of student voice are critical components of the learning environment at AVM. Martinez educators and staff build a strong foundation of centering students at the forefront of their work.
Our students tackle projects that meet near the intersection of environmental and social justice, rooted in our communities.

The 1881 Institute (1881) is a nonprofit organization that consists of various interventions to meet the needs of vulnerable populations in high school, college, out-of-school youth, and unemployed young adults. Following a denied charter school application to the Orleans Parish School Board, the organization formed a homeschool cooperative in response to parents of children in 1881's after-school programs who were unsatisfied with their public school option. The cooperative is a free early college model that prepares teens for dual-enrollment in a technical vocation as an entryway into engineering careers.
suggested_tags:
1. emphasis on hands-on learning
2. Serving primarily African American students, autonomy has allowed us to institute the successful values and methods  implemented after Reconstruction that created, by the year 1900, a virtually non-existent illiteracy rate among African-Americans under the age of 40.

school_description: We are an accredited University-Model(R) school. Highly qualified teachers provide instruction in the central classroom two (PreK-6th) to three (7th and up) days a week . The remaining weekdays are spent at the satellite classroom completing reinforcement assignments and projects. Parents and/or private tutors attend valuable training workshops to help ensure quality mentoring and learning at home. Both classrooms are under the supervision of the professional educator at the school. The purpose is to to assist multicultural Christian families in building a legacy of servant leaders who stand up for Biblical values in an exceedingly compromising culture.
suggested_tags: Classical Education; National Institute for Learning Differences (NILD) Discovery Program; Parents as Co-Teachers;

school_description:
Portal Schools is an emerging network of micro schools seeking to change the way students experience and succeed in education. The campuses are small - 60 students at each location, with the goal to create local networks of up to 8 schools in various regions. 

The academic program allows students to complete both a high school diploma and a bachelors degree in five years or less all while engaging in increasingly more complex career exposure and training. Each of the campuses are co-located on corporate partner sites to directly embed academic learning with career learning in the daily student experience.
respondent_role: Director of Outreach and External Affairs

school_description: We are a collective that works to provide equitable access to homeschooling and intergenerational learning that centers our Indigenous and BIPOC indents, histories, languages and cultural ways. We are deeply rooted in social justice because it's a part of our everyday lives and we work to co-create a more just world for one another and our future generations.

The Oceti Sakowin Education Learning Center is Indigenous learner centered. By CENTRALIZING Indigenous language and culture, we:
- facilitate and engage in collective healing
- change the lens through which we view and learn about the world
- honor our ancestors by persisting and preparing future generations; and
- show up as relatives who are grounded in Indigenous values and kinship systems.
suggested_tags:
Co-created daily schedules: 
Our approach is one that responds to the changing needs of our learners. The learners and facilitators identify and discuss daily needs and co-create the schedule daily. This requires intentional planning and flexibility.

school_description: Atlas Elementary is a new school for curious, creative, and compassionate kids. As a result of our innovative school model, not only do Atlas kids love coming to school, but they are equipped with the critical thinking and problem solving skills needed to thrive in the 21st century. Our students flourish because we focus on educating the whole child, and are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining highly effective educators.
suggested_tags: co-taught classrooms, at home learning, year-round calendar

school_district: State Charter Schools Ii- Georgia Fugees Academy Charter Sc
school_description: Georgia Fugees Charter Academy School approaches education from a comprehensive student development framework integrating academics, sports, and social-emotional wellbeing.  Fugees is a tuition free, community-based, public charter school designed to meet the needs of refugee and new American students who have experienced disrupted formal education through holistic English language acquisition and foundational study, culturally relevant curriculum and wraparound support including arts programming and soccer participation. Every student and staff member works together as a team member on and off the field to bridge significant gaps in formal schooling to ensure that students graduate on time and ready for career or college.
suggested_tags:
comprehensive student development
holistic English language acquisition
supportive and rigorous
soccer
fun

school_name: Dallas Hybrid Preparatory At Stephen J. Hay
school_description:
Dallas Hybrid Preparatory is a rigorous yet flexible learning environment intentionally designed to build students' agency, creativity, and collaboration in a safe and inclusive learning environment. We balance learning from home three times a week with learning in-person, twice a week.  

Our focus:

Gamification in E-Learning
Project-Based Learning
STEM Career Pathways
E-Sports, Coding, and Makerspace
suggested_tags: Gamified learning environment, Individualist, Empowerment, Student Agency

school_address: 718 W. Riverside Ave. Suite 201 Spokane WA 99201
school_description: Lumens learning environment is built on belonging, empowerment, flexibility, tenacity & discovery and is a place where our parenting students role as a parent is never at odds with their role as a student.

Our goal is to provide every student with personalized learning and real-world instructional experiences in an environment that centers around the learner. We provide an extended-year, personalized learning community program with a project-based approach. Understanding that relationships and learning experience design are the keys to success in learning, the student experience is coordinated by a
team of Learning Community Leaders and Learning Coaches who guide students through gradually increasing levels of mastery and independence.

Rainier Valley Leadership Academy is an anti-racist collaborative community school serving 6th-12th grade. We're focused on dismantling oppression through scholar leadership, preparing scholars for college and career readiness with a SEL focus.

Crotona International High School is a school for newly arrived immigrant children. They are new to the language, culture and country. Through our project based instructional model and core principles of experiential learning, heterogeneity and collaboration, language and content integration, localized autonomy and one learning model for all, we provide wholistic education to our students. We have structures like advisory, mentoring and small classes to support every student academically as well as socio-emotionally. To graduate our students create in depth projects and present their learnings to several stakeholders.

Unison is a small, community-based middle school in Central Brooklyn that aims to provide each child with an individualized educational experience so that each and every child can thrive. The school cares deeply about its community, cares deeply about disrupting societys inequities and preparing students to be active agents of change for themselves and their community. Unison is a school where everyone has a seat at the table.

Codmans program is built on a holistic philosophy that seeks to address students' physical and mental health needs along with their academic success. Based on EL Education principles, our curriculum stresses depth over breadth of content and fieldwork designed to reinforce classroom learning. A strong emphasis on the arts, social justice issues, and STEM are cornerstones of our curriculum.

From day one, Perea Elementary aimed to prepare students academically, socially, and emotionally for success today and tomorrow. The goal was to offer a safe, supportive learning environment where students excel through active engagement in meaningful learning experiences. The school also set out to build strong relationships between students, families, and the school, with the goal of creating a community the neighborhood, was proud to call its own. In the early years of Perea, there was significant pushback from families around the approach the school took to social-emotional learning. Families would report not wanting their students to spend time identifying their emotions, for example. In five years, and particularly after the COVID-19 pandemic, the communitys views on SEL have shifted. Now families routinely reach out for additional resources around strategies used in school. In addition, mental health has become less of a taboo topic and families have increased their willingness to have their students evaluated for special services if needed.

Nueva is a dynamic community committed to educating gifted learners from pre-kindergarten through high school. Our mission is to inspire passion for lifelong learning, foster social and emotional acuity, and develop the imaginative mind. Our motto is learn by doing, and learn by caring.  The Nueva Way brings interdisciplinary learning to students, integrating their education with their observations of the world. Teacher partnerships and collaboration across subject areas provide rich assignments where students learn in layered, interdependent, and complex ways. Nueva faculty prepare our students to be problem solvers today, facilitating learning opportunities that tackle complex, meaningful issues. They blur the lines between the world and the classroom.  We teach to the stage, not the age, of each student. This personalized approach results in stimulating learning experiences, driven by our students curiosity. Nueva students learn by doing. They construct knowledge through hands-on engagement. As experts in project-based learning, teachers guide authentic, purposeful investigations that enable discovery while building the skills students need to be successful.  Student choice is woven into all of their learning. Their interests guide their studies, sparking authentic questions, deep investment, and joy in learning. They have a voice in choosing themes, topics, activities, clubs, and much more, as classroom and community citizens. This personalized approach results in stimulating learning experiences, driven by our students curiosity.

At Kairos, we believe now is the opportune moment to rethink public education. That's why we replace lectures with engaging projects and dictatorial ""behavior managers"" with 1-1 executive functioning coaches who help students learn how to manage their own schedule and work habits. Kairos students practice navigating real-world choices (such as when, where, how, and with whom to work) within a safe, supportive school environment. Kairos develops students not just into freethinkers, ready to thrive in a modern economy, but self-governing citizens, ready to lead both themselves and their communities.  Personalized Learning  Some students excel at English; others struggle with math. Our multimedia coursework adapts to meet kids where they are. It's like giving every student a textbook tailored to their exact questions and learning style. Paired with one-on-one tutoring, the differentiated instruction challenges everyone but leaves no one behind.  Mentoring & Choice  Students meet with their mentor every week to develop the mindsets, skills, and habits of productivity. Working with families, mentors gradually transition students to college-style self-directed learning. Students guide this transition, earning more scheduling choice as they make responsible study decisions.  Project-Based Learning  To prepare students for 21st-century careers, Kairos coursework trades mindless memorization for creative, hands-on projects. The world is our classroom, and students learn about it firsthand through experiential field trips and internships.  Civic Leadership  Kairos students do more than just talk about leadership. They practice it by leading study groups, extracurricular clubs, and student government. From mediating peer discipline to advising our school board, students own more than just their schedules and educationthey own their community.

school_desc_other_text: Some of our students participate in virtual instruction, hybrid instruction, and small learning environments.
school_description: The current system tends to be a heterosexual white male, liberal arts-focused curriculum on an agrarian calendar. Our preferred future of learning recognizes the contributions of all to teach learners in a flexible, adaptive, and culturally-responsive method. The current system places focus on assessment scores in order to fund and provide opportunities for progress in education. State, national, and cognitive assessments focus on the deficits of a learner, institution or potential future. Present models in education tend to be deficit-based. They highlight the problems of a child, such as a childs (dis)ability and focus on what is missing instead of what can be accomplished. Deficit-based models lead to a downward spiral of burnout and depression among students and staff. Our preferred future of learning focuses on the individual learner with an asset-based approach, highlighting their individual strengths and designing a curriculum based on their needs and desired future.  Our preferred future centers on a curriculum that commits to justice and equity. Our preferred future curriculum recognizes the collective impacts of all members in society and champions their contributions. This future understands that there will be constant work toward a more perfect union and provides all learners with an authentic education focused on the diverse cultures of our world. We will center our curriculum development on justice and equity, highlighting the lost voices of the past in our readings, videos, and learning materials. We will enable every learner and their family to flourish by centering the instruction on their individual needs and progress. The team-effort in the childs instruction will allow all voices to be heard and will focus on the childs abilities and needs in order to succeed in their future. Our just future includes a curriculum as diverse as our world in voices and materials where every learner has the voice to determine their criteria for success.  Our work focuses on student engagement in universal individualized educational programs using a Montessori educational theory based curriculum with instructional sources from global perspectives. An Individualized Learning Program (ILP) is developed for each child. This allows for a team approach to a childs education and will document both successes and goals toward the progress of each individual child. Finally, we seek to emerge by providing all children a Glocal Curriculum (Hale & Fisher, 2013). Children learn locally, but seek to make change globally in the world. In order to accomplish this, we need to ensure that the curriculum is a global curriculum, providing for diverse perspectives and experiences.  We see evidence of improving the curriculum through resources like the 1619 Project (New York Times, 2019). By using multiple media, articles, live events, podcasts, the project sought to reframe the countrys history and highlight the contributions of Black Americans in the United States. Ensuring that the African-American story was told, the 1619 project, made black writers an essential element of the story of the United States. We seek through our project to ensure the diverse stories are told in a glocal curriculum, through multiple media.

We are an inquiry-based school, which means that learning is hands-on, emergent, relevant, and centers the student in the learning process. Through a process of identifying and exploring big questions, we connect content across disciplines and situate the learning in the context of the real world around us. Social justice is a throughline in how we think about our role as learners and change-makers in creating a more just world. And, as a school committed to anti-racist teaching and learning, we work to ensure all students are validated, affirmed, and supported -- in particular students in our problem of practice who are most impacted by racist, white-dominant systems and structures.

Rogers High School learning environment provides all students with rigorous and relevant experiences in preparing students for college, career and life post high school. Students drive their learning through ownership, autonomy and pursuit of passions, where educators harness close relationship and connectivity to act as guides to the learning and growth of each student.

At Manchester High School we activate a unique educational experience for students by empowering each student to realize their path, their strengths, and their stories. While we recognize that we are existing within an inequitable system, we are transforming the school experience through building genuine relationships with and connectivity to the educational experience for all students, especially those who are often marginalized in our society, in order to ensure all students thrive. We cultivate authentic student engagement, amplify student voice, and redefine how we support our students, by actively listening. We strive to foster a greater differentiation of academics, as well as center the educational experience around student learning needs and interests. In supporting each student for who they are and bringing all voices together we are empowering students to become their best selves.

Vision for the Muiz City as Campus Model At the end of a 5-year period we envision a high school experience driven by our students voice that ensures relevant experiences in a city as a campus model facilitated with community partners. Our mission is intimately linked to the three overarching drivers in our model that fuel the Qualities of the Scholar: antiracist for equity practices, our dual language approach and EL inspired framework.  Essentially, our work is clear with purpose and intentionality. Students learn in both English and Spanish with classes in school and off-campus in authentic and relevant community experiences. Every student is working towards the Qualities of the Muiz Scholar and every adult equally owns and espouses these ideals.   Every student develops their identity, and is empowered with the skills and knowledge to achieve their post-graduation goals. Through our continued support, we grow the number of students who persist in their college and career goals to 75%.

school_name: Hartford Area Career and Technology Center
school_description: Hartford Area Career & Technology Center (HACTC) recognizes that education is a life-long experience. The Center creates a nurturing environment in which applied contextual learning occurs. HACTC promotes the development of career skills to prepare students for success in our increasingly demanding information-based society. HACTC brings hands on learning for students in the Upper Valley of Vermont and New Hampshire.

school_desc_other_text: A Pathway of a comprehensive high school
school_description: Evolve Academy is a project-based, competency-based pathway that builds on the individual strengths of students who have disengaged from traditional high school. We empower youth to develop the mindsets and skills to succeed in high school and achieve their goals for post-secondary education and employment. We build a culture of holistic support, promote rigorous, student-centered academics, and facilitate real-world opportunities to learn and serve in the community.
Students own their learning. Students own their career. Students own their results. Students own their behavior.

school_desc_other_text: Our students can choose to take in-person any of the 24 campuses in our district and choose to take classes online.
school_description: PXU City provides the most innovative high school experience where The City is Your Classroom, and the future is your choice. . A student at PXU City will earn course credits in-person and online from any PXU campus. Flexible schedules allow students to participate in rigorous courses, go in-depth through internships and earn credit for work experience. Students can help their families, without negatively impacting their academics. Wrap-around services and technology ensure every student is successful. PXU City deepens the connection between students and the city of Phoenix so that its not just The City but Their City. Unique connections and experiences throughout Phoenix; learning about the city and its history, visiting our capital, engaging with professionals and leaders, visiting sister cities, and exploring Arts and Cultural museums-all connected to standards-earn credits in a brand-new way. Our goal is to develop students who are ready to succeed and lead, not only in todays Phoenix but in todays world.

AIM was created with the belief that children with language-based learning disabilities can and will thrive in a rigorous academic setting when they are taught by a highly committed, experienced and creative faculty who have ongoing access to the latest research, best practices, technological resources, and experts in their field. We dedicate ourselves to putting research into practice every day. AIM Academy students thrive in classrooms that offer multisensory and experiential learning and our programs are designed to foster self-esteem and social responsibility. Their academic and intellectual development is further enhanced by an array of extracurricular activities and enrichment in the arts, athletics and community service. It is our goal, that upon graduation, our students are prepared for the challenges, complexities and choices available to them at university and beyond. Curiosity, collaboration, compassion, confidence and critical thinking are their tools for success.  The AIM Institute for Learning & Research is a center for educational excellence and professional development providing teachers and professionals who work with children who learn differently with specialized training programs and access to the latest research and best practices for the classroom. The Institute is committed to quickly translating laboratory research into effective interventions and educational practices for all students.

Our Mission Keres Childrens Learning Center (KCLC) strives to reclaim our childrens education and honor our heritage by using a comprehensive cultural and academic curriculum to assist families in nurturing Keres-speaking, holistically healthy, community minded, and academically strong students.
grades_other_text: Infant/Toddler Classroom = 6 Primary Classroom = 5 Elementary Classroom = 11 Adolescent Classroom = 1

school_description: UP Academy is a progressive K-8 micro-school that utilizes a concept and project based curriculum that allows students to apply the knowledge, skills and concepts they master in school to the real world.    Our students develop 21st century skills, a global perspective, and empathetic action in an environment that nurtures creativity and encourages curiosity.  We empower students of all abilities to find strength in their community, believe in the power of their ideas, and influence action in the world around them.  Our small, mixed age classes create a loving environment where each student builds a strong relationship with the peers and educator resulting in a deeper and richer educational experience.  We meet students at their level and create the right amount of challenge for them to achieve their goals while loving learning. Content is not age or grade specific, it is student specific.  We believe that a good educational model isnt everyone getting the same thing, it's everyone getting what they need to be successful and thrive.   Deep, interdisciplinary project based learning contributes to the magic of Up Academy.  Students engage in meaningful projects that allow them to engage authentically in their community to solve problems.   Over the course of a trimester the students are able to grow in wonder as they make discoveries and explore their topic through hands-on activities and field trips.   Each project culminates with an exhibition day, where the students get to demonstrate their learning and craftsmanship.   Our students focus on developing their own identities as individuals and an understanding of who they are as Americans in a global world, humans in a diverse ecosystem, and critical questioners in an ever changing environment.    UP Academy students are contributing global citizens who are fearless advocates for their health, community, and ideas.

Icon Preparatory School is a unique HBCU elementary school with high student expectations that serves the urban core of Jacksonville, Florida. We focus on the whole child and empower our students to become great. Our classes are small and we use technology as well as the arts to keep our students engaged at a high level.

school_address: 350 S. Figueroa St., Suite 250, Los Angeles, Ca 90071
school_description: Students enrolled in Ednovate Virtual Academy will have access to a high-quality, college-prep education focused on three main areas: wellness, community, and a personalized educational experience. Each day, students can expect to meet with their advisory class, attend live learning pods with a credentialed teacher, and complete work at their own pace. Each week, students will have the chance to meet one-on-one with their advisor, as well as participate in community-building activities. All courses are A-G approved and count as full credits towards their California and Ednovate graduation requirements. Students will have a learning pod assigned to them for each of their four core classes. Learning pods will be run by a certified Ednovate teacher who will facilitate live learning through the use of mini-lessons, small groups and tiered interventions, shared experiences, and peer collaboration. Flex time will give students more freedom to choose how to spend their time. Students may have mandatory appointments such as special education services, tutoring, college counseling, or one-on-one meetings with their advisor. However, students will also have some choice on how to spend their time during their flex time. For example, students can choose to work on elective courses, work on PMC Journey projects, get tutoring, go to events to earn PMC hours, or even help their family with responsibilities.  Students have daily advisory in cohorts between 15-25 students to build community and engage in socio-emotional check-ins as a group. Advisors will be provided with baseline materials for academic support for students (grade trackers, etc), as well as virtual advisory materials. Advisors will also be able to support students through targeted interventions when needed. Additionally, each student will have a bi-weekly one-on-one check-in with their advisor to set and support goals. Monthly, there will be at least one school-wide community-building event for students to learn, engage, and celebrate. Advisors will also be in contact with parents of advisees to support their success in the virtual program.

Our school is designed to center the identities and histories of our scholars, as these elements of their person are typically isolated or erased from curricula and/or taken out of consideration when developing instructional programming. The idea is to establish an environment where the whole child-- all parts of their identity-- are considered with intentional empathy and rigor to help them grow academically and as leaders.   Additionally, we support college and career readiness through the intentional development of a pathway to concurrent enrollment courses early in the High School Experience. There are career and mentorship opportunities through our Enrichment programming twice a week during the school day; we partner with local organizations to curate experiences for scholars to receive instruction in areas of interest like audio production, cybersecurity certification, coding and programming, and cultural exploration. Competency as measured by the ACCUplacer exam is a graduation requirement for our school district. We administer the assessment within the first 6 weeks of our scholars' High School experience as 9th graders. This serves as a benchmark for where they are in terms of accomplishing a graduation requirement and allows us to begin planning for the Spring semester course selections. Scholars who demonstrate competency become eligible for enrollment in courses that bear High School and College credit (Concurrent Enrollment). The ultimate goal is to ensure as many scholars as are eligible are able to take at least one Concurrent Enrollment Course and 35% of each graduating class will leave High School with an Associates Degree.
inclusive_other_text: Scholars identified as (Highly) Gifted and Talented.

school_description: The Perry Ingenuity Institute (PII) is a STEM and design school within Perry Elementary School offering personalized learning and flexible structures. Authentic learning opportunities, student voice, and learning connected to a students zone of proximal development are the hallmarks of the program. Routines and schedules are designed and redesigned to meet the needs of our students so that every student has a joyful learning experience that is winnable for them.
focus_other_text: Students in need of tier 2 and tier 3 academic support.
nominator: Ohio Department of Education: The Innovation Lab Network

school_description: At Aggie Academy, our young scholars are excited about their new and innovative experiences not shared in many of the local area elementary schools. They are:  	exposed to multiple opportunities to think critically and creatively 	taught how to problem solve with projects within the STEAM framework 	partnered with college volunteers from our sponsor, North Carolina A&T State University

The learning environment at San Luis High School has created a learning experience for students where they are provided multiple learning pathways that enable every learner to be college, career, and community ready on a personal path.   - Through course requests students can select courses that align with their interests. Our master schedule is then built around student course request interest.   - Multiple pathways are available such as dual credit in Math, English and CTE courses, industry certifications available through CTE courses, and rigorous courses through advanced placement.    - Students track their data and regularly set goals during time designated across the campus.   - All teachers offer choice through Universal Design for Learning, allowing students options in how to access, engage, and demonstrate learning. Choice boards, multiple assessment opportunities, and collaboration in small groups based on data provide a just-right learning environment.   - The early shifts to standards-based grading are providing an equitable system of assessment and reporting (about 60% of our classes are SBG). Proficiency scales are being used and further developed to show the progression from basic to advanced.    Student Agency has been a natural outcome based on the learning pathways at San Luis.

A Culture of Learner Agency.  At Cibola High School, teachers are empowered to design learning opportunities and experiences that impact the whole student. Instruction is aligned to the standards with equitable assessment and grading practices.  Teachers are given autonomy and highly encouraged to take risks, learn from each other, and share instructional strategies that support learner-centered practices.    Flexible learning environments encourage our students to have a voice in the learning process, collaborate with peers, and own their learning by choosing the learning resources, asking questions, managing progress, and determining whether or not theyve mastered the standards.    At Cibola High School, students have become active participants in supporting the implementation of our Portrait of a Graduate by breaking down the key attributes and competencies in student-led staff development workshops.  Furthermore, students often play critical roles in providing community tours of our school, showcasing the various ways in which staff and students work together to prepare all students for life after high school.

Students engage in a student centered culture and learning environment. Equitable practices are applied to student grading and evaluation while teachers select teachers implement personalize learning strategies.

school_desc_other_text: We are a contract school partnered with University of Memphis and Memphis Shelby County Schools that is a lab, Dual Enrollment school.
school_description: Our learning environment is designed for students to be conscious of their own growth and development as it correlates with our core competencies that prepare them for the 21st century. Individual reflections and group celebrations of growth in these areas happen each quarter. UHS Competencies: entrepreneurial mindset awareness of self and others equity mindedness and inclusivity creativity  collaboration curiosity self-efficacy judiciousness flexibility   Additionally, students have an opportunity to plan their desired future with college and career in mind, long-term, but also with specific dual enrollment, internship, and summer programming in mind for their high school journey. We designed our dual enrollment track with the University of Memphis to provide high interest, high quality courses that meet industry needs for the future.

As we develop students who know themselves deeply and are poised to work with others to make a positive impact in the world, we believe we will get there by aligning all aspects of our school model to three primary tenets. The first tenet is developing a deep sense of belonging ensuring that all students are safe, feel seen, and thrive in a context of strong relationships.  We believe this goes hand in hand with our second tenet: rigorous academic experiences, which includes creative and innovative learning opportunities that cultivate the skills needed to thrive in the 21st century. The third tenet authentic leadership focuses on leveraging relationships and a sense of belonging, alongside each students toolkit of academic skills to practice and exercise leadership in ones own life and the world around them.

The students experience at this school is purposeful and full of intention.  We aim to ensure that each child enters the school setting with the understanding that we love and generally care about them. We make all decisions in the best interest of the child.  Additionally, we offer a learning environment which fosters more than one learning modality.  The students receive instruction which incorporates auditory, visual and kinesthetic.  Students are exposed to violin, soccer, dance and Z-lab which enables them to become well rounded individuals.  The exposure to limitless opportunities which is comprised of both academic and social entities has helped the students develop critical thinking which is needed as a life long skill.

The student experience at Zeta is unique. Our strong foundation of social emotional learning/awareness and our rigorous academics allows our students to confidently conquer challenges and advocate for what they believe in! Their experience at Zeta is setting up to be successful beyond our walls and fosters a journey that allows them to thrive!

Our vision is to become an exemplary leader in providing an exceptionally high-quality, competency-based high school experience to pregnant, parenting and underserved students.  We do this through a rigorous, relevant and coherent learning experience that is grounded in deeper learning. We foster classrooms where students are doing the cognitive lift where ""all minds are on"".
nominator: Center on Reinventing Public Education, Barr Foundation

school_name: Opportunity Academy at Holyoke High School
school_desc_other_text: Opportunity Academy (OA) is an umbrella, more-so than a school. Comprised of three campuses, and virtually limitless options, and school day structures, OA makes up all of the alternative pathways for students in Holyoke Public Schools' high schools, including dual enrollment, hybrid options, personalized learning, project-based courses, and more.
